articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of South Sudan
articles.content:
Kim Yong NamGreets President of South Sudan
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Salva Kiir Mayardit on the foundation of the Republic of South Sudan on July 9 and his assumption of the presidential office.
					 The message expressed the stand of the DPRK government to develop relations with South Sudan in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, sincerely wishing the president and people of South Sudan success in the work for the country's development and prosperity.

articles.title: British Guests Here
articles.content:
British Guests Here
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labour Party, and his companion arrived here Sunday by train.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Chinese
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Chinese
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Zhang Ming, head of the visiting art group of dance drama "Confetti on Silk Road" of the Gansu Provincial Song and Dance Theatre of China, said he was very excited to see General Secretary Kim Jong Il during the DPRK visit.
					 Zhang, who is vice-director of the Cultural Department of Gansu Province, said: 
					
					 Kim Jong Il watched our performance though he was pressed for time and highly appreciated it. 
					
					 Our art group was honored to perform before Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 We were deeply moved by his personality as a great man. 
					
					 We feel pleased about our performances in the DPRK.
					
					 The artistes of the Gansu Provincial Song and Dance Theatre of China gave a performance before President Kim Il Sung 30 years ago. 
					
					 China and Korea are friendly neighbors linked by the same rivers and mountains.
					
					 The bilateral friendship forged by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries is developing day by day. 
					
					 We will make positive efforts to contribute to the development of this friendship. 
					
					 We hope that the Korean people will achieve bigger successes under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: China Reaffirms Stand to Develop Friendly Ties with DPRK
articles.content:
China Reaffirms Stand to Develop Friendly Ties with DPRK 
Beijing, July 16 (KCNA) -- Hong Lei, spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of China, reaffirmed the country's stand to steadily develop the friendly ties with the DPRK at a regular press briefings held in Beijing on July 14. 
					 Hong said: 
					
					 The China-DPRK treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance has played positive role in promoting the development of Sino-DPRK relations and defending the regional peace and stability for 50 years since its conclusion. 
					
					 The Chinese side understands that it is common interests to seek negotiated settlements of issues, defend peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula and denuclearize it and ensure long-term stability on the peninsula. 
					
					 This is the most fundamental starting point and target for China when approaching the Korean Peninsula issue.
					
					 We will direct efforts to steadily developing the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations and play a constructive role in defending the regional peace and stability.

articles.title: Syrian PM Stresses Need to Develop Syria-DPRK Ties
articles.content:
Syrian PM Stresses Need to Develop Syria-DPRK Ties
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Adel Shaffar, prime minister of Syria, met with the DPRK government economic delegation headed by Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam and had a friendly talk with it on July 14. It attended the 7th meeting of the DPRK-Syria Joint Economic Committee which was under way in Damascus. 
					 The Syrian prime minister said Syria set store by the traditional relations with the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed the expectation that the bilateral ties would further develop through the meeting of the joint committee. 
					
					 He hoped that the party, government and people of the DPRK would make bigger progress and prosperity under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Phibada Opera Troupe 40 Years Old
articles.content:
Phibada Opera Troupe 40 Years Old
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- 40 years have passed since the Phibada Opera Troupe was founded.
					 The troupe set July 17, 1971 when it gave premiere of the revolutionary opera "The Sea of Blood" (Phibada) before President Kim Il Sung as its foundation day.
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the troupe adapted the immortal classic work authored by the President to revolutionary opera through new creative activities early in the 1970s.
					
					 Therefore, Korean-style revolutionary opera "The Sea of Blood" was created as a model of the Juche-based operatic arts with the introduction of verse-songs, pangchang, dance, stage arts, orchestral music and others.
					
					 The opera has so far been staged 1,600 times, evoking lively responses at home and abroad.
					
					 The troupe received Order of Kim Il Sung in recognition of its great contribution to the development of the operatic arts.
					
					 It produced many people's artistes, people's actors and actresses, merited artistes and merited actors and actresses to become well known as a famous art troupe. 
					
					 In recent years it successfully re-created opera "A Dream of Red Mansions", an adaptation of old Chinese novel.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (14)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (14)
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- In September last year leader Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to a factory in Jagang Province where he gladly raised his hand to acknowledge a scientist at a combined control room.
					 The scientist was Jong Il Chol, a room chief of the Automation Engineering Department of Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was so glad to meet Jong again, saying that he met Jong at the dehydrated apple slices plant of the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm in June. He called him today's "Hong Kil Dong", a nickname reflecting his loving care and trust, saying Jong goes to the different parts of the country to translate into reality the idea of the Party to push back the frontiers of the latest science and technology.
					
					 Inspired by the warm loving care shown by the leader who remembered even an ordinary scientist whom he briefly met in the course of his field guidance, Jong studied and introduced the field bus control system with the use of intelligence regulator. He is now striving to apply the combined automation system to machine factories. 
					
					 He is working hard at the worksites to build a thriving nation, cherishing the leader's loving care.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces US-S. Korea Military Exercise against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces US-S. Korea Military Exercise against DPRK
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- South Korean puppet warmongers recently staged the combined exercise of the Marine Corps with the U.S. imperialist aggression forces in areas around Paekryong Island for more than 10 days under the pretext of "decisive counteraction to provocations". 
					 This is another dangerous military provocation aimed at a surprise preemptive attack on the DPRK, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in a bylined commentary. 
					
					 It goes on: 
					
					 It is not secret that the areas around five islands in the West Sea turned into bases of the south Korean army from which to launch the armed provocation to invade the DPRK. 
					
					 The army is frequently waging madcap war exercises in the areas after massively bolstering up the offensive armed forces, thus fortifying the islands and turning them into advance bases. 
					
					 It is giving spurs to strengthening the drills and its operation commanding system and beefing up forces and armed equipment while putting forward the Marine Corps as a shock brigade in launching a war against the north. The recent combined exercise of the Marine Corps proves that its adventurous scenario for a preemptive attack on the north is becoming a reality.
					
					 If it persists in the moves for military provocations and war in the areas around the five islands in the West Sea, the areas will turn into the crematory of south Korean and U.S. warmongers. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group should behave itself, mindful that military confrontation would bring it shameful defeat and death.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Papers Sunday dedicate bylined articles to the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Theory of Musical Art."
					 The work gives scientific answers to the principled issues on the essence, mission, contents and style of music based on the immortal Juche idea and fully indicates the ways of building the Juche-based music.
					
					 The articles say that the work has served as an encyclopedia of building musical art for popular masses aspiring after independence.
					
					 The work is a great immortal program as it comprehensively indicates in depth the principled requirements and ways to be constantly maintained in building and creating the Juche-based musical arts ranging from the essence and mission of the Juche-based music to the issues on composing and playing music and training reserves, Rodong Sinmun notes, and goes on:
					
					 Since the publication of the work the Juche-based musical art in the DPRK has covered the shining path of development, making genuine contribution to accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Songun. It thus proved in practice the scientific accuracy and validity of the idea and theory contained in the work. 
					
					 The idea and theory of the work have been successfully put into practice under the leadership of Kim Jong Il in the new century.
					
					 He saw to it that "The Blue Sky over My Country" was re-created as a famous song of the Songun era and a grand art performance was given with this song as a main song. 
					
					 Masterpieces of the past have been re-created as the famous art pieces of the Songun era under his guidance, proving the validity of the idea and theory of the work in reality. 
					
					 Thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il who has worked heart and soul to make the Korean people enjoy the most excellent and beautiful music, great and wonderful concerts were given on significant national holidays. This helped the musical arts of the DPRK develop in conformity with the feature of a thriving country. 
					
					 Performing activities have been popularized on a higher level. The activities of art groups of working people including the contests of art groups of military families are accounting for an important proportion of the musical art of the Songun era. This is the valuable result of the vitality of the idea and policy of the work. 
					
					 Minju Joson says that the work serves as important guidelines to be maintained in creating and building the musical arts in the era of Juche for its scientific profundity, truth, originality and revolutionary character.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Build Jeju Naval Base Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Build Jeju Naval Base Slammed
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Measure Council for Checking the Construction of the Jeju Naval Base denounced the puppet authorities for their moves to build the base at a press conference in Seoul on July 13.
					 At the press conference speakers condemned the authorities for pushing forward the construction of the naval base on Jeju Island despite the people's protest.
					
					 Personages of different social standings and members of international peace organizations have waged solidarity actions against the construction of the base, they said, adding they would intensify the actions against the "government" and the "National Assembly."
					
					 In an appeal the organization underlined the need to stop the construction of the naval base that threatens peace in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia and deteriorates the living of the Jeju islanders.

articles.title: End to Suppression of S. Korean Organization Demanded
articles.content:
End to Suppression of S. Korean Organization Demanded
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) in a commentary on July 13 denounced the puppet authorities for their suppression of the organization.
					 The court authorities on July 12 held a trial of the chief editor of the organ of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon but the trial was postponed again due to the lack of evidence, the commentary said.
					
					 This proves that the authorities have suppressed the organization even though they had no evidence, it charged.
					
					 If Lee Myung Bak, the Intelligence Service, the prosecution and the court do not want to be put to shame any longer, they should stop the suppression of the South Headquarters and withdraw the illegal indictment, it stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Brushing aside Workers' Demand for Wage Hike
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Brushing aside Workers' Demand for Wage Hike
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on July 13 condemned the authorities for brushing aside the demand of the workers for wage hike.
					 The Minimum Wage Committee on July 12 railroaded the 2012 bill on the hike of minimum wage in an absence of worker representatives, the commentary said.
					
					 The bill reflected the stand of the businessmen to drastically lower the hike limits, not the demand of the people to raise the minimum wage to 50 percent of the average wage of the workers, it noted.
					
					 It blamed Lee Myung Bak and the minister of Employment and Labor for appointing those who knew nothing about the wage issue to the post of members of the Minimum Wage Committee.
					
					 It urged the "government" to make an apology for railroading the bill and accept the demand of the people.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Crimes Censured
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Crimes Censured
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification held a meeting in Tokyo on July 13 to condemn the heinous crimes of the Lee Myung Bak group.
					 Chairman of the Association Ri Tong Je in a report denounced the Lee Myung Bak group for committing hideous provocations hurting the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 He underlined the need to reveal to south Koreans and overseas compatriots the heinous acts of treachery committed by the group and conduct the dynamic work to expand and strengthen the pro-reunification patriotic forces.
					
					 Speakers branded the group of traitors as maniacs of confrontation rare in history and an unpardonable group.
					
					 The meeting adopted a statement titled "We will take the lead in the dynamic struggle to terminate the heinous moves of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for confrontation with fellow countrymen."

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Various events were held in Pakistan, Myanmar, Poland, Democratic Congo and Peru on July 7 and 8 on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. They included remembrance meetings, photo exhibitions and film shows.
					 On display in the venues were works of Kim Il Sung and  General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos on their immortal exploits.
					
					 Films dealing with the revolutionary history and immortal exploits of Kim Il Sung were shown.
					
					 The minister of Public Welfare of Sind State Government of Pakistan, the chairman of the Association for Self-Reliance Studies and other speakers said Kim Il Sung devoted his all not only to the Korean revolution but to global independence and development of the non-aligned movement. They expressed belief that his exploits would shine through centuries.
					
					 The director of Myanmar Medical Research Institute said the path of Juche opened by the President was a righteous way of realizing the ideal of the people and a way of national self-sustenance that helps increase the national power by one's own efforts.
					
					 The deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Democratic Congo and the chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru noted with appreciation that the President made immortal contributions to the cause of global independence.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events in Pakistan and Poland.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Revolutionary Life Praised
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Revolutionary Life Praised
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Cuban newspaper Granma on July 8 carried an article praising his brilliant life devoted to the country and the people with his photo.
					
					 The 25th issue of Russian newspaper Patriot carried an article titled "Leader of People" with a picture of smiling Kim Il Sung and photos of the three generals of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Kuwaiti newspaper AlÔºçRai on July 7 said the DPRK's policy is oriented to carrying forward the President's intention and cause, adding his desire is coming true one by one.
					
					 The Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on July 9 posted on its Internet homepage an article saying the President turned the Workers' Party of Korea into a guiding force of the revolution and the DPRK into a socialist state of Juche.

articles.title: Solidarity for Korean People's Struggle for Reunification Expressed by Bangladeshi
articles.content:
Solidarity for Korean People's Struggle for Reunification Expressed by Bangladeshi 
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy on July 12 issued a statement on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 Under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung the Korean people won a brilliant victory in the three-year Fatherland Liberation War, an event to be specially recorded in human history, the statement said.
					
					 The dark clouds of a war still hang over the Korean Peninsula, it noted, terming the U.S. the very one responsible for Korea's division and the U.S. forces in south Koreas the main obstacle lying in the way of Korea's reunification.
					
					 All the world peace-loving people should show concern for the issue of Korea's reunification, it noted, and went on:
					
					 We extend firm solidarity to the army and people of the DPRK, convinced that they would register bigger successes in their efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and reunify the country under the uplifted banner of Songun.

articles.title: Hu Jintao Calls upon Youth to Promote Development of Cross-Straits Relations
articles.content:
Hu Jintao Calls upon Youth to Promote Development of Cross-Straits Relations
Beijing, July 16 (KCNA) -- Hu Jintao, general secretary the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, called upon the youth to further develop the cross-straits relations. He said this at a joint cross-straits gathering of young people held at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on July 12.
					 In recent years the cross-straits relations have maintained the excellent trend of peaceful development, he noted, adding that is why the young people could freely visit across the straits as today.
					
					 The promotion of the development of the cross-straits relations entirely depends on the young people, he said, calling upon them to boost exchange and cooperation to open the beautiful future of the prospering Chinese nation.

articles.title: Week for Cultural Information Service of Revolutionary Tourist Resorts Starts in China
articles.content:
Week for Cultural Information Service of Revolutionary Tourist Resorts Starts in China
Beijing, July 16 (KCNA) -- A week for cultural information service of revolutionary tourist resorts started recently in Shaoshan of Hunan Province, China, as part of the month of national revolutionary tour.
					 It is co-sponsored by the China National Tourist Administration and the Office of the National Cooperation Group for Revolutionary Tour.
					
					 Its theme is "Let us build excellent tourist zones and inherit revolutionary spirit."

articles.title: Iran Urges IAEA to Adopt "Appropriate" Measure on Iran's Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
Iran Urges IAEA to Adopt "Appropriate" Measure on Iran's Nuclear Issue
Tehran, July 16 (KCNA) -- Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesman Ramin Mehmanparast called on the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) to adopt "appropriate" measure with respect to the country's nuclear program.
					 "We expect IAEA officials to take appropriate action in clarifying issues and informing the world public opinion about honest efforts of Iranian authorities," Mehmanparast told reporters in Nigeria on Wednesday. 
					
					 He emphasized that discussions about Iran's nuclear issue have been influenced by political pressure exerted by the U.S. and its allies.

articles.title: Iranian Minister of Information Rejects US Threat
articles.content:
Iranian Minister of Information Rejects US Threat
Tehran, July 16 (KCNA) -- The Iranian minister of Information at a press conference on July 13 scathingly rejected the U.S. threat to his country.
					 The U.S. defense secretary on July 11 threatened that it would not allow Iran to offer weapons to the resistance forces in Iraq. The minister termed it nonsensical.
					
					 The U.S. has futilely posed such threats to Iran for decades, he added.

articles.title: Iranian President Calls for Heightening Vigilance against US Moves
articles.content:
Iranian President Calls for Heightening Vigilance against US Moves
Tehran, July 16 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in a diplomatic appearance on July 11 called for heightening vigilance against the U.S. moves aimed at the division of regional countries.
					 The U.S. is resorting to deceptive moves to spark off disputes between Iran and Arab countries in a bid to help the Israeli regime tide over a crisis, he said.
					
					 He stressed the need for the regional countries to resolutely reject the U.S. interference in the internal affairs with sharp vigilance.

articles.title: Reparation for Maltreatment within SDF Demanded in Japan
articles.content:
Reparation for Maltreatment within SDF Demanded in Japan
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The Shizuoka District Court of Japan Monday demanded the government reparation for the maltreatment practiced within the Air "Self-Defense Force."
					 The court made this ruling after discussing a suit filed by the family of a member of the SDF who committed suicide in Hamamats air base.
					
					 It is said that the SDF member had been violated and persecuted by his superior.

articles.title: Five More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghan istan
articles.content:
Five More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- More NATO soldiers met deaths while waging an "anti-terrorist war" in Afghanistan.
					 Five were killed in an insurgent attack in eastern Afghanistan on Wednesday.

articles.title: PLO Condemns UNESCO for Listing Jerusalem as Israel's Capital
articles.content:
PLO Condemns UNESCO for Listing Jerusalem as Israel's Capital
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) on Thursday condemned listing Jerusalem as Israel's capital on the website of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).
					 Identifying Jerusalem as Israel's unified capital "is a procedure against humanitarian and international legitimacy and the Security Council's resolutions that consider East Jerusalem as an occupied city," said the PLO in a statement.
					
					 The PLO called on the UNESCO to withdraw this classification, stressing that East Jerusalem is part of the Palestinian lands that Israel occupied in 1967.

articles.title: Unidentified Planes Checked from Entering Sky above US Presidential Villa
articles.content:
Unidentified Planes Checked from Entering Sky above U.S. Presidential Villa
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The North American Air Space Defense Command announced on July 9 the U.S. aircrafts checked two unidentified mini-planes trying to enter the sky above the presidential villa near Camp David in the suburbs of Washington that afternoon.
					 Similar case took place on July 2, the command said.

articles.title: Venezuela Censures US for Politicizing Anti-Drug Campaign
articles.content:
Venezuela Censures US for Politicizing Anti-Drug Campaign
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- A vice-minister of Interior of Venezuela on July 12 denounced the U.S. for trying to politicize the anti-drug campaign.
					 The UN defined Venezuela as a country with no drug-related crimes but the U.S. included it in the list of those countries not honoring the international convention on anti-drug campaign, he said, adding:
					
					 This shows the U.S. is abusing the anti-drug action as a political weapon against Venezuela.
					
					 Referring to the gains made by his country through the anti-drug campaign this year, he said the U.S. tops the world list of the illegal drug users.

articles.title: Indonesia to Boost Renewable Energy Supply
articles.content:
Indonesia to Boost Renewable Energy Supply
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian government Wednesday has made a master plan for development of renewable energy resources as the country seeks to gradually reduce reliance on fossil fuels.
					 Under the master plan Indonesia will do the work to actively develop and use solar energy for the next 15 years.
					
					 The government decided to allot many funds to this.

articles.title: Angola to Strengthening Naval Force
articles.content:
Angola to Strengthening Naval Force
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Angola is paying deep attention to strengthening the naval force.
					 The chief of the Staff of the Angolan Navy at a recent ceremony stressed the need to build the strong and well-prepared navy.
					
					 Sea is very important both in economy and defense of the country, he noted, calling upon the seamen to clearly understand their mission and make positive efforts to discharge their duty.
					
					 Meanwhile, the minister of Defense of Angola called upon the seamen to intensify monitoring activities and strengthen the combat preparedness to defend the territorial waters and sovereignty.

articles.title: Ancient Egyptian Drawing Unearthed
articles.content:
Ancient Egyptian Drawing Unearthed
Cairo, July 16 (KCNA) -- Egypt's archaeologists have recently unearthed a 5,200-year-old rock drawing in the southern city of Aswan.
					 The scenes were part of a series of rock drawings featuring hunting, fighting and celebrations. They are important data in studying the culture in those days.
